body_html: Even though docs do not cover the case when foo.dim()>2, I think this is a bug (also in master). Fortunately, torch.distributions.Categorical(foo3).sample((100,)) works on master (not sure about 0.4.1), so you can use that for now.
body_text: Even though docs do not cover the case when foo.dim()>2, I think this is a bug (also in master). Fortunately, torch.distributions.Categorical(foo3).sample((100,)) works on master (not sure about 0.4.1), so you can use that for now.
body: Even though [docs](https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/torch.html#torch.multinomial) do not cover the case when `foo.dim()`>2, I think this is a bug (also in master). Fortunately, `torch.distributions.Categorical(foo3).sample((100,))` works on master (not sure about 0.4.1), so you can use that for now.
